page.title: 12PUTLANDS FARM, FAIRWARP
page.content: At Putlands Farm, Fairwarp, the owners are experimenting with milking dairy sheep. Jacob and Friesland sheep are used mainly. 150 sheep are kept; 40 are milked. Each sheep produces approximately two litres of milk per day. Four day old lambs are bottle fed so that ewes can be milked. The sheep's diet is enriched with hydroponically grown wheat, oats and beansprouts. Sheep's milk is more easily digestible than cow's or goat's milk and does not cause allergies. The milk is made into yoghourt and cheese and can also be frozen in bags. At present it is mainly sold in health shops.
